query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

result.title: Requirements for multi-level reconfigurable manufacturing execution
result.description: Report providing a thorough analysis of the industrial needs for real time reconfiguration as well as the technical specifications on how to address these needs. The key elements of ASSISTANT real time control reconfiguration will be reported

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Analysis of past extreme events, lessons learned and SoA models
result.description: It is related to task 1.1 and 1.2. This deliverable will report the analysis of extreme events based on historical data and their consequences in all CSA areas. This report will also explain the reason behind the failure of prediction (if any), possible model error and drawbacks. The first version of the deliverable contains the historical data collection status, statistics and primary analysis. It will also report the initial status of SoA models for each case study. Each CSA partner will be responsible for their own data collection, analysis and reporting to UIB. UIB will combine them to a deliverable.

result.title: Dissemination, exploitation (including IPR) and communication plan
result.description: A dissemination strategy and communication plan as well as a plan for the exploitation of the EMPOWER project results will be developed at the beginning of the project. The IPR management activities are an integral part of the EMPOWER exploitation activities and will also be in this deliverable. The Dissemination, exploitation (including IPR) and communication plan will be updated constantly throughout the project.

result.title: Data management plan
result.description: The DMP describes the data management life cycle for the data to be collected, processed and/or generated by EMPOWER. As part of making research data findable, accessible, interoperable and re-usable (FAIR), the DMP includes information on the handling of research data during & after the end of the project, what data will be collected, processed and/or generated, which methodology & standards will be applied, whether data will be shared/made open access, and how data will be curated & preserved (including after the end of the project).The DMP will be updated regularly throught the entire project.

result.title: First release of the multi-omics platform (pre-clinical trials)
result.description: An algorithms able to associate various biomarker levels observed in infants with ASD and GI symptoms. This alghorithm will use advanced statistical analysis methods such as sparse canonical correlation (a linear correlation method) combined with random forests (a non-linear correlation method) to detect these associations between the omics data.
